com.bham.bd.entity.ai.behavior

Class FreePathCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.entity.ai.behavior.FreePathCondition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Condition

    public class FreePathCondition
extends Object
implements Condition

    Condition for checking whether a straight path (represented as a rectangle) between 2 points is free. It tests whether the path intersects any obstacles in the game map but it doesn't check for any character or bullet collision.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Point2D end
      destination point a path ends at
      private double radius
      radius of an entity that has to fit through the path (i.e., half of the width of the path)
      private Point2D start
      source point a path starts from

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FreePathCondition()
      Constructs a condition with placeholder points and a radius of 1 representing the path as a line
      FreePathCondition(double radius)
      Constructs a condition with placeholder points and a given radius
      FreePathCondition(Point2D start, Point2D end)
      Constructs a condition with 2 provided points and setting radius to 1 (as if it was a line)
      FreePathCondition(Point2D start, Point2D end, double radius)
      Constructs a condition with 2 provided points and a given radius

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Sets 2 points as testing values for the getPath() method.
      void setTestValues(Point2D start, Point2D end, double radius)
      Sets 2 points as testing values for the getPath() method.
      boolean test()
      Tests for the path to not contain any obstacles in its area

    • Method Detail

      • setTestValues

        public void setTestValues(Point2D start,
                          Point2D end)
        Sets 2 points as testing values for the getPath() method. The path will be checked between them.
        Parameters:
        start - source point a path starts from
        end - destination point a path ends at

      • setTestValues

        public void setTestValues(Point2D start,
                          Point2D end,
                          double radius)
        Sets 2 points as testing values for the getPath() method. The path will be checked between them.
        Parameters:
        start - source point a path starts from
        end - destination point a path ends at
        radius - radius of an entity that has to fit through the path (i.e., half of the width of the path)

      • getPath

        public Rectangle getPath()
        Returns the path from start to end point

        It calculates the angle and the distance between them, creates a rectangle of the same length as the distance and rotates it appropriately to connect the 2 points. The height of the rectangle is defined by the radius property, i.e., the height is twice the radius size.

        Returns:
        a properly rotated Rectangle object connecting start and end points

      • render

        public void render(GraphicsContext gc)
        Renders the calculated path red if there are obstacles in it and green otherwise
        Parameters:
        gc - graphics context on which the path will be drawn

      • test

        public boolean test()
        Tests for the path to not contain any obstacles in its area
        Specified by:
        test in interface Condition
        Returns:
        true if there are no obstacles in a way and false otherwise
